how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: Yes, and I am the only editor/administrator of my wiki(s)
do you publish your wiki(s) online?: to: Yes, using a single-file wiki;Not publishing to this location
putting it all together, what value does: An easy to edit way to collect note and information about our internal developments.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles;I have written custom JavaScript
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver);Single-file wiki with TiddlyDesktop
how do you back up/sync changes between: N/A - I keep my wiki on a single system

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: I almost always have a custom stylesheet. Use of plugins depends on the wiki! I have sometimes used templates, but find them complicated.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: I like the fact that it is open source, built on well-known web technologies, and that it is possible to enhance with plugins.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: I exclusively use TiddlyWiki as a single-page file not hosted anywhere. The biggest issue is the saving mechanism. If there was some way to become a non-issue, that would be the biggest improvement IMHO.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
